review: My Chromecaset will connect to my WIFI, but not to the Internet.  I am researching router settings to overcome this, but so far without success.
author: Robert Moody

review: The Google Chromecast device is growing on me. I bought this with the hopes I would be able to play my android games on the T.V. I was disappointed and to be honest, I am still not clear on why this is not a feature with this device or why it connects to both my phone and tablet when I start streaming from one device. But what I am loving about this is the streaming of Google Play Music, BeyondPod Podcast, and Netflix to my bedroom television. The PS4 is in the living room and is my primary source of Netflix. But now I can watch it in my room. I will continue to use this device.
author: Murdic3k

review: Chrome was insanely easy to setup and allows me to stream 1080p movies from all sources. It also allows me to control it with just my smart phone.  Other similar products don't have IR support or a solution that does not involve a wireless keyboard/mouse. Highly  recommended for everyone!

review: I bought this back in February to give as a gift for graduation, so it was not used for the first time until very recently. Unfortunately, it turns out that the Chromecast does not work at all, and when it is plugged in, there is no menu that appears but instead, a black bar shows up on screen (we have used a Chromecast before, so we know how it should work). Since it was purchased awhile ago, it is no longer eligible to be returned or exchanged, so now I just have a product that does nothing. Maybe I just got a defective product, but it's unfortunate that there is no warranty on it.
author: Madeline
